trustfund:
TF092213-ANGOLA - STRENGTHENING PUBLIC
            SECTOR GOVERNANCE CAPACITY IN THE WORLD B
theme: Poverty strategy, analysis and monitoring,Macroeconomic management,Economic statistics, modeling and forecasting,Tax policy and administration,Public expenditure, financial management and procurement

abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Management Technical
            Assistance Project for Angola aims to strengthen the
            Government's capacity to formulate sound analysis and
            to implement sound policies in areas which are critical to
            the management of public resources, including: poverty
            analysis; setting-up a monitoring and evaluation system;
            formulation of a sound Public Investment Program (PIP); and
            the establishment of a more transparent and efficient public
            finance framework. The project will focus on key economic
            policy implementation agencies: Ministry of Planning
            (MINPLAN), Ministry of Finance (MINFIN), and the Central
            Bank of Angola (BNA). The project components are: 1)
            planning component will support efforts at establishing
            methodologies for the preparation, execution and monitoring
            of sector and provincial plans and the PIP; 2) statistics
            component will support the implementation of the recently
            prepared Five-Year Plan for Statistics; 3) public finance
            component will support the MINFIN's public finance
            modernization program; and 4) Central Bank operations
            component (BNA) will continue supporting improvement of BNA
            operations and the full implementation of Angola's
            payment system. The ultimate goal of this project is to
            facilitate the establishment of the appropriate policy and
            governance framework for sustained medium-term growth, in
            the wake of the transition from civil war to peace.
